title: Three man are injured in stabbing in south London car park
text:
Police are investigating after three people were stabbed in what is believed to have been part of the same incident in a south London car park.

Officers and paramedics were first called to reports of a stabbing on Campshill Road in Lewisham at about 5.55pm on Thursday and found a 19-year-old man with stab injuries.

He was treated at the scene before being taken to hospital.

Three men have been stabbed in Lewisham, south east London on Thursday evening

Officers believed the three men had been wounded in the same incident in a car park on Harvard Road, SE13 shortly before 6pm yesterday

A short time later, a 20-year-old man attended a south London hospital with stab injuries thought to be non-life-threatening.

Three males were arrested at the hospital on suspicion of possession of an offensive weapon and a Vauxhall Astra parked outside was seized.

Police were also called to Lewisham Park shortly before 6pm, where they discovered a 23-year-old had also been wounded.

He was taken to hospital and police are awaiting an update on his condition.

The Metropolitan Police said they believed the stabbings were all part of the same incident in a car park on Harvard Road.

A Mercedes was seized at that location, while a different Vauxhall Astra was seized in Fordyce Road.

A section 60 order has been put in place across the whole of the borough of Lewisham, allowing the force to stop and search anyone without reasonable grounds for suspicion.

Three men have been arrested on suspicion of possession of an offensive weapon
description: Scotland Yard has placed a Section 60 order on the whole of Lewisham following the stabbings. Officers can stop and search anyone in the area without reasonable grounds for suspicion.
